Description: Trans Energy, Inc., an oil and gas exploration company based in Pleasants County, West Virginia, was sentenced to two years of probation and ordered to pay fines totaling $600,000.00 after the company admitted to multiple violations of the Clean Water Act in connection with its natural gas drilling activity.
Info Source: http://www.justice.gov/usao-ndwv/pr/local-oil-and-gas-company-fined-600000-clean-water-act-violations

Description: The Department of Justice, the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency and the West Virginia Department of Environmental Protection announced a settlement with Trans Energy Inc., requiring the oil and gas company to restore portions of streams and wetlands at 15 sites in West Virginia that were polluted by the company's unauthorized discharge of dredge or fill material. Trans Energy agreed to pay a penalty of $3 million to be divided equally between the federal government and the WVDEP.
Agency: Environmental Protection Agency referral to the Justice Department
Info Source: http://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/trans-energy-inc-restore-streams-and-wetland-damaged-natural-gas-extraction-activities-west
https://www.law360.com/articles/1113214/eqt-gets-final-ok-for-2-8m-wage-and-hour-deal

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
NAICS Translation: 237120: Oil and Gas Pipeline and Related Structures Construction
Info Source: February 7, 2020 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.
